cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles NE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to begin drifting north on Monday, then accelerate north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s Big Bend, eventually crossing inland and moving through Georgia/South Carolina mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Steinhatchee area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time (only Yucatan and W Cuba listed)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None at this time (only Yucatan Peninsula listed)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast from Tampa Bay northward to Apalachee Bay and the Florida Big Bend, then inland across southeast U.S.
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-storm-force winds possible (34-57 kt) with a 34 % cumulative chance, peak likelihood around 96 h (Tuesday night–early Wednesday). Small (8 %) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Model guidance suggests a 3–5 ft surge is possible in Tampa Bay if the cyclone tracks just north of the port, especially around Wednesday high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 in of rain possible mid-week with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk in low-lying port and terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Outer rainbands may produce brief tornadoes and squalls that could interrupt cargo and crane operations.
